intro: Erigeron mimus, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features silvery-blue foliage and produces clusters of tiny white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Erigeron mimus is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to attract pollinators like butterflies and bees.
